by Skial Bainn published on Thursday 29th May 2014

# Haxe Roundup № 126

Nape 2.0 is out! I didnt even know it had a website.

Castle Siege by Lubos Lenco has won a prize in the Samsung Smart App Challenge!!

Adrian has released recorded gameplay of Pole Vaultage which you can play!

Checkout the video Debugging HXCPP applications in IntelliJIDEA.

Something else thats looking awesome, the new Evoland website is now live!

Florian Hofmann has written a blog post on how to use Air Native Extensions in Haxe. Lets hope it can help Andy Moore get SteamWorks working with his game.

Greg Caldwell shows a couple of videos and more on his partial port of Away3DLite for NME.

As Christmas approaches how about installing Blitzen or an Advent Calender both built with NME?

Not looking forward to Christmas, then maybe checkout Justin's javascript canvas experiment Haxe Zebra.

With the Github Game Off challenge over, here are the games I could find :

MrPushPull by ProG4mr. The objective is to kill all the cats and turtles. Avoid getting killed by the turtles. source.

Push/Pull Factory by Gagege. You and a friend/enemy are two government contracted hazardous-materials sorting robots. Orders for 3 deadly elements; Lithium, Plutonium, and Uranium, are coming in fast. It's up to you to fulfill those orders! source.

Save The Clones by Jacic. When scientists cloned the newly discovered alien humanoids, they never suspected that the clones might not want to take part. source.

And finishing off, Joshua shows a sneak peak at something he's working on, expect awesome.

Update 6/12/12

Flambe 2.0, the fast, expressive game engine has been released. As a major release it has breaking changes so read the migration guide.

Emiliano Angelini has announced that his NME game Sophies Drawings will be available from Decemeber 12th for iOS. Go checkout the trailer.

Michal has written about his experiences going from Flash to NME with his game Blocky. He explains the build process, asset management and more.

Mihail has announced a project he's working on, Gameplay neko and cpp bindings, the crossplatform 3D engine by BlackBerry. Read the haxe mailing list post for the full details.

Thanks to ProG4mr for emailing me about Github Game Off finishing and suggesting to do a mini roundup of games made with Haxe.

If you have made a game with Haxe for the Github Game Off challenge and its not listed, leave a comment below and I will add it asap.
